com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.elements

Class ViewElements

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.elements.ViewElements
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<ViewElement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContainerViewElement, FieldsetViewElement

    public class ViewElements
extends Object
implements Iterable<ViewElement>
    Represents a manageable collection of ViewElement instances. Every element in the collection must have a unique name, and every ViewElements will behave as part of the larger collection. That means that names must be unique across all elements in this collection directly and in any of sub collections added through groups.
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

      • ViewElements

        public ViewElements()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(ViewElement element)
        Add the element directly to this collection. If anywhere in this collection there is already an element with the same name, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        element - element to add

      • addFirst

        public void addFirst(ViewElement element)
        Add the element directly as the first element to this collection. If anywhere in this collection there is already an element with the same name, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        element - element to add

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(String elementToMove,
                      String newParent)
        Will move an element with a given name from its current position (anywhere in the collection) to the last position of all children of the new parent. The parent must be a ViewElements instance.

        Moving will fail silently if either the element is not found, the parent is not found or the parent is not of type ViewElements.

        Parameters:
        elementToMove - name of the element to move
        newParent - name of the new parent element
        Returns:
        true if element was moved, false if it could not be moved for any reason

      • moveToFirst

        public boolean moveToFirst(String elementToMove,
                           String newParent)
        Will move an element with a given name from its current position (anywhere in the collection) to the first position of all children of the new parent. The parent must be a ViewElements instance.

        Moving will fail silently if either the element is not found, the parent is not found or the parent is not of type ViewElements.

        Parameters:
        elementToMove - name of the element to move
        newParent - name of the new parent element
        Returns:
        true if element was moved, false if it could not be moved for any reason

      • addAll

        public void addAll(Iterable<ViewElement> elements)
        Adds all elements directly to this collection. If any of the elements duplicates the name of an already present element, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        elements - elements to add

      • remove

        public <V extends ViewElement> V remove(String elementName)
        Remove the element with that name from wherever it may be in the collection.
        Parameters:
        elementName - name of the element to remove
        Returns:
        element that was removed - can be null

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the collection has no children

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        Number of direct children

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements.

      • get

        public <V extends ViewElement> V get(String elementName)
        Returns:
        instance with that name, or null if not found

      • getParent

        public <V extends ViewElements> V getParent(String elementName)
        Searches for the group an element belongs to. If the element is nowhere in the collection or it is a direct child of this set, the parent will be null.

        This will only search top-down and not return any groups that are higher than the current set (in case the current set is also owned by a ViewElements.

        Parameters:
        elementName - name of the element
        Returns:
        parent group element or null if direct child or element not found

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String elementName)
        Returns:
        true if anywhere in the collection there is an element with that name.

      • sort

        public void sort(String... elementNames)
        Attempts to sort all elements in this collection according to the order specified by the element names passed in. This will sort recursively, if element names are mentioned that are part of a group, they will be sorted according to the order specified within that group.

        A group itself will only be moved in relation to its other siblings.

        Parameters:
        elementNames - Collection of element names in order.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<ViewElement> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<ViewElement>
        Returns:
        iterator for all direct children in this collection
